image.altText: A composite image of Keelty, Bachtiar, Howard and a supercomputer.

items.synopsis: Political editor Andrew Probyn reveals Australian intelligence's critical role in undoing the men who committed the 2002 Bali bombings — and how a shard from a Nokia phone brought them down.

title.children: How spies used a shard of an exploded Nokia phone to expose the Bali bombers

image.altText: A black and white image of Lorraine Peeters sitting on a chair at a table as a young girl

items.synopsis: Telling her truth helps Lorraine Peeters heal from the trauma of being snatched from her parents as a child and sexually abused while being trained to become a servant for wealthy non-Indigenous families.

title.children: 'A smorgasbord for the matron': Stolen Generations survivor reveals sexual abuse at Aboriginal girls home

image.altText: Nurses Brenna Warren (left) and Rebecca Adam

items.synopsis: Two young women who were born prematurely at the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital now work as nurses, caring for a new generation of sick newborns.

title.children: Brenna and Rebecca were both born premature. Now they're helping deliver babies in similar situations

image.altText: a woman wearing a bathing suit standing next to a column

items.synopsis: Two cases, less than six months apart, of women found dead after a delay by NSW Police raises questions about how many other victims of violence are being let down, writes crime reporter Lia Harris.

title.children: A woman was found dead in Sydney after a delayed response to triple-0 call, but she's not the only one

image.altText: A concept image for a new Chinatown in Melbourne showing a huge two floor glass building with red neon lights.

items.synopsis: As Chinatown struggles to return to its pre-COVID golden age, younger generations have been busy creating cultural hubs of their own.

title.children: Is Chinatown worth reviving? Or is it just a facade for tourists?

image.altText: Australia's Prime Minister drinking beer with a group of people in Vietnam, Hanoi.

items.synopsis: Over beers made from Australian barley, Anthony Albanese toasts Australia's growing trade relationship with Vietnam.

title.children: Albanese visits Hanoi to highlight Australia's growing economic ties to Vietnam

image.altText: Barker with female stall holders and cameraman giving thumbs up as food served from pots.

items.synopsis: After a tumultuous posting marked by natural disasters and disrupted by the COVID pandemic, Indonesia correspondent Anne Barker signs off, reflecting on the big stories, the highs and lows.

title.children: ABC correspondent Anne Barker farewells Indonesia and the world's 'friendliest and most-cheerful' people

image.altText: A green 'for rent' sign with LEASED stickers stuck on it.

items.synopsis: While Philip Lowe says he wants more people in dwellings, data from house sharing site Flatmates says this is already happening as cost of living and inflation continue to bite Aussies hard.

title.children: Record-breaking numbers are searching for flatmates with older generations increasing the most

image.altText: rescuers at india rail accident

items.synopsis: Officials say rescuers found no more survivors in the wreckage of two passenger trains that derailed in eastern India, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi reaches the scene.

title.children: Officials announce end to rescue efforts at India's deadly rail accident

image.altText: trash on mountain

items.synopsis: Food wrappers, tents, plastic and human waste being discarded by climbers staying at the mountain's base camps.

title.children: It's a record Everest climbing season and rubbish is piling up

image.altText: A young Afghan woman wearing a blue high-necked, sleeveless dress poses for a photo.

items.synopsis: Samira was forced to cover her face and body as she fled her homeland. She has now transformed her burqa into a party dress; an act of protest against the Taliban regime and its modesty rules.

title.children: Samira was forced to wear a burqa to flee Afghanistan. She's now turned it into a party dress

image.altText: A teenager with pink hair sits on a park bench, smiling

items.synopsis: American teens are in the grip of a mental health crisis, and one US state says the best way to protect them is to limit their access to social media platforms such as TikTok and Instagram.

title.children: US teens are grappling with 'persistent sadness'. Is controlling their social media the answer?

image.altText: Woman with short brown hair in a blue polo shirt.

items.synopsis: Antibiotic resistant superbugs are wreaking havoc as experts warn we're in a race against time to find new treatments.

title.children: The world is running out of treatments for deadly infections, but an ancient animal may hold the answer

image.altText: David Warner walks under an Australia flag

items.synopsis: Opening batter David Warner says he will retire from Test cricket midway through the 2023/24 Australian summer season with plans to bow out at the SCG.

title.children: David Warner announces retirement plans

image.altText: Photo of a blue marron on grass.

items.synopsis: Marron, a large freshwater crayfish endemic to WA's south west, could be soon produced by robotics and artificial intelligence in an effort to boost the availability of the lucrative crayfish to consumers.

title.children: Robots and artificial intelligence could soon be rearing lucrative and highly sought after marron

image.altText: A middle-aged athletic man in a blue jersey holds a yellow Sherrin AFL football as he stands on a football field.

items.synopsis: Hawthorn coach Sam Mitchell says whether Cyril Rioli can mend relations with the Hawks amid the racism saga is up to the four-time premiership star.

title.children: Hawthorn coach Sam Mitchell says he 'feels for everyone' linked to racism saga

image.altText: A group of students in a crowd shouting

items.synopsis: As the 34th anniversary of China's Tiananmen Square crackdown approaches on Sunday, many in Hong Kong are trying to mark the day in private ways in the shadow of a law that prosecuted leading activists in the city's pro-democracy movement.

title.children: China's 34th Tiananmen Square anniversary marked in private for activists in face of pressures

image.altText: Yevgeny Prigozhin leaves a cemetery. He is bald and stares at the camera from a distance.

items.synopsis: Russian mercenary leader Yevgeny Prigozhin says that Kremlin factions are destroying the state by trying to sow discord between him and Chechen fighters.

title.children: Wagner chief says Kremlin factions are destroying the Russian state

image.altText: A hairdresser with bright pink hair is working on a client with purple and green hair inside a salon.

items.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis is turning everyday expenses into guilty luxuries, and that's sent young people's sense of wellbeing to record lows.

title.children: 'It's a luxury': Navigating the guilt of 'me-time' spending in a cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Two young women, one in a military uniform and the other in a military T-shirt, comfort each other as one cries.

items.synopsis: Reports differ on the exact nature of what occurred during the gun battle, but both sides have linked the exchange of fire to an earlier drug-smuggling attempt.

title.children: Three Israeli soldiers, Egyptian officer killed in rare gun battle along Israel-Egypt border

image.altText: A man speaking to the press with another man behind him in front of a Liberal Party banner.

items.synopsis: Gold Coast city councillor and planning boss Cameron Caldwell wins the Liberal Party's preselection battle for the federal seat of Fadden and will be the frontrunner when the northern Gold Coast electorate heads to the polls in July.

title.children: LNP settles on Stuart Robert's successor for 'rolled-gold' Queensland seat

image.altText: The entrance to the school grounds of Adass Israel School, on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: Police re-open investigation relating to Malka Leifer fleeing Australia in 2008

title.children: Police re-open probe into Melbourne school's role in helping Malka Leifer leave Australia

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

items.synopsis: At the outset, Walter Sofronoff thought he would have to consider if charges should have been laid against Bruce Lehrmann. But when he asked anyone involved in the inquiry if they wanted to argue against the prosecution, you could hear a pin drop.

title.children: As the inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's trial wrapped up, it was clear the goalposts had shifted

image.altText: The shell of a burned-out car on the back of a tow truck.

items.synopsis: Witnesses have rushed to aid a young mother, following a car fire in Perth's eastern outskirts which left more than a third of her body with serious burns. Her husband has been taken into police custody.

title.children: Woman ran screaming for help from flaming car as police investigate family violence

image.altText: A soldier stands on the street surrounded by debris from protest.

items.synopsis: A Turkish defence ministry official says around 500 Turkish troops would be going to Kosovo.

title.children: Türkiye announces commando battalion group to join NATO forces in Kosovo

image.altText: Two F1 cars driving down the main straight, touching their wheels with some debris flying off one of the cars.

items.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri will start Sunday's Spanish Grand Prix in the top-half of the grid, as big names struggled in Barcelona.

title.children: Mercedes suffer 'scary' collision as Piastri shows pace in Spain

image.altText: black and white photo shows three women in uniform looking backwards and they walk up a dirt driveway

items.synopsis: In a suburban Brisbane garage, young women decoded radio transmissions that changed the course of World War II. For the first time, their top-secret work on a panicked Japanese cable about a new type of weapon can be revealed.

title.children: The top-secret WWII cable from a panicked Japanese officer that landed in a Brisbane garage — revealed for the first time

image.altText: Jason Cummins screams and points down

items.synopsis: Joy for the Mariners, as Central Coast clinch the second A-League Championship in club history after a dominant second half against Melbourne City. Follow live.

title.children: Joy for the Mariners as Central Coast crowned Australian kings of football

image.altText: A man in glasses with a large brown mark on one cheek

items.synopsis: Professor Dan Angus was being interviewed in a ABC News television story when a doctor he'd never met noticed a sinister spot on his face while watching from home.

title.children: When a doctor saw this image on TV, he sent a potentially life-saving email

image.altText: a boat travelling out to rescue a whale calf

items.synopsis: Specialist crews along with two volunteer vessels from Marine Rescue NSW successfully disentangled the calf on Saturday at about 4.30pm.

title.children: Young baby humpback whale free after 'complex' operation off Wollongong coast

image.altText: Reece Walsh runs with the ball

items.synopsis: Brisbane are back on top of the NRL ladder after an impressive 20-12 victory over Cronulla-Sutherland at Shark Park. Earlier the Rabbitohs's 46-28 win over the Titans is soured by injuries to Jai Arrow and Cameron Murray.

title.children: Broncos earn impressive win over top-four rivals, Cronulla
